bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to John and Robin Kellogg, February 12, 1942

div1.p: Hench thanks the Kellogg children for their letter, which delighted him.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to John and Robin Kellogg, February 12, 1942
div1.p:
If you got as much pleasure out of the candy
which I sent as I gout out of your letter, I will be
delighted.

I certainly like your letter. You say that you
hope in some way John and you can repay me for my kind-
ness and that you hope that “1942 has no errors”. You
already have repaid me by being such sweet kids. Just
keep that way and that is all that is necessary.
div1.closer:
Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. Miss Robin and Master John Kellogg
113 Berkeley Place
Glen Rock, N. J.
